content.raw:
I modified it to make it completely optional.  It will now present a warning if the library is not detected and disable benchmarks accordingly. 

This will give us a little breathing room to get the other \(non-pipelines\) CI runs to include it.
content.html:
I modified it to make it completely optional. It will now present a warning if the library is not detected and disable benchmarks accordingly.

This will give us a little breathing room to get the other (non-pipelines) CI runs to include it.

content.raw: Just curious...I see this is a template for generating a .py file. Is it not possible to have a regular .py file and pass these parameters as command line arguments when running the script?
content.html: Just curious...I see this is a template for generating a .py file. Is it not possible to have a regular .py file and pass these parameters as command line arguments when running the script?

content.raw: Better to use `os.path.join` instead of `/`.
content.html: Better to use os.path.join instead of /.

content.raw: Consider doing `time.strftime("%Y-%m-%d_%H-%M-%S")`. The output of `str(time)` is different if `microsecond` is 0. https://docs.python.org/3/library/datetime.html#datetime.datetime.isoformat
content.html: Consider doing time.strftime("%Y-%m-%d_%H-%M-%S"). The output of str(time) is different if microsecond is 0. https://docs.python.org/3/library/datetime.html#datetime.datetime.isoformat

content.html:
Example version_info.json:

{
  "hg":
  {
    "hash": "4162950e6b3a+",
    "revision_number": "2596+",
    "branch": "default"
  },
  "ignition":
  {
    "version": "2.0",
    "version_full": "2.0.0~pre1",
    "major": "2",
    "minor": "0",
    "patch": "0"
  },
  "build":
  {
    "cmake_build_type": "RelWithDebInfo",
    "build_time": "2019-04-08T08:51:39"
  }
}
